member.name: T:Infragistics.XF.BarsFillMode
member.summary: BarsFillMode specifies how the grid fills within the barcode control dimensions.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.BarsFillMode.FillSpace
member.summary: FillSpace mode ensures that the barcode grid fills the control dimensions.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.BarsFillMode.EnsureEqualSize
member.summary: EnsureEqualSize mode ensures that every grid column/row has the same pixels number width/height. The sum of all columns/rows pixels may be less than the width/height of the control.

member.name: T:Infragistics.XF.EanUpcCodeType
member.summary: EAN/UPC types of barcode

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.EanUpcCodeType.Ean13
member.summary: A type of barcode EAN-13

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.EanUpcCodeType.Ean8
member.summary: A type of barcode EAN-8

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.EanUpcCodeType.UpcA
member.summary: A type of barcode UPC-A

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.EanUpcCodeType.UpcE
member.summary: A type of barcode UPC-E

member.name: T:Infragistics.XF.Code128CodeType
member.summary: Code128 types of barcode

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Code128CodeType.Standard
member.summary: CODE128 standard encodation. No FNC1 in first or second symbol character position after Start character.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Code128CodeType.Ucc
member.summary: GS1-128 (also known as UCC/EAN-128) - encode full list of AI (Application Id). FNC1 in first symbol character position after Start character

member.name: T:Infragistics.XF.GS1CodeType
member.summary: GS1 Databar barcode types.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.GS1CodeType.Omnidirectional
member.summary: GS1 DataBar Omnnidirectional code type - intended for retail Point-of-Sale scanning

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.GS1CodeType.StackedOmnidirectional
member.summary: GS1 DataBar Stacked Omnidirectional code type - intended for retail Point-of-Sale scanning

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.GS1CodeType.Expanded
member.summary: GS1 DataBar Expanded code type - intended for retail Point-of-Sale scanning

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.GS1CodeType.Truncated
member.summary: GS1 DataBar Truncated code type - not intended for retail Point-of-Sale scanning

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.GS1CodeType.Stacked
member.summary: GS1 DataBar Stacked code type - not intended for retail Point-of-Sale scanning

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.GS1CodeType.Limited
member.summary: GS1 DataBar Limited code type - not intended for retail Point-of-Sale scanning

member.name: T:Infragistics.XF.HeaderDisplayMode
member.summary: Enumerated type that represents a header display mode.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.HeaderDisplayMode.Hide
member.summary: Hide the header.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.HeaderDisplayMode.Show
member.summary: Show the header.

member.name: T:Infragistics.XF.MaxiCodeErrorCorrectionLevel
member.summary: Error Correction Level for MaxiCode symbology

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.MaxiCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.Standard
member.summary: Standard Error Correction Level for MaxiCode, encoding 144 codewords, 93 of them are for data encodation, 1 is used for specifying the mode, 50 codewords are used for error correction. 22 erroneously decoded codewords can be corrected.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.MaxiCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.Enhanced
member.summary: Enhanced Error Correction Level for MaxiCode, encoding 144 codewords, 77 of them are for data encodation, 1 is used for specifying the mode, 66 codewords are used for error correction. 30 erroneously decoded codewords can be corrected.

member.name: T:Infragistics.XF.ModeIndicator
member.summary: The possible modes values for the MaxiCode control, which allow various structures of the symbol data and error correction. The mode is encoded as part of the Primary Message.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.ModeIndicator.Mode2
member.summary: Mode 2 is used in the transport industry for encoding numeric postal code. The first 120 bits encode the Structured Carrier Message with Enhansed Error Correction. The rest of the symbol is free for other uses and employs Standard Error Correction.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.ModeIndicator.Mode3
member.summary: Mode 3 is designed to be used in the transport industry of an alphanumeric postal code. The first 120 bits encode the Structured Carrier Message with Enhanced Error Correction. The rest of the symbol is free for other uses and employs Standard Error Correction.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.ModeIndicator.Mode4
member.summary: Mode 4 is for Standard symbol encoding. It indicates that the symbol employs EEC in the Primary Message and SEC for the Secondary Message. It provides 93 codewords for data encodation.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.ModeIndicator.Mode5
member.summary: Mode 5 encode full message using ECC. It provides 77 codewords for data encodation.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.ModeIndicator.Mode6
member.summary: Mode 6 is used for reader programming. The symbol encodes a msg used to program the reader system and SEC is used for the Secondary Message. No data shall be transmitted.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.CodeSet.A
member.summary: Code Set A is the default code set at the start of every MaxiCOde symbol.

member.name: T:Infragistics.XF.Pdf417ErrorCorrectionLevel
member.summary: The possible values for the PDF417 Error Correction Level.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Pdf417ErrorCorrectionLevel.Level0
member.summary: Error Correction Level 0 has 2 codewords

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Pdf417ErrorCorrectionLevel.Level1
member.summary: Error Correction Level 1 has 4 codewords

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Pdf417ErrorCorrectionLevel.Level2
member.summary: Error Correction Level 2 has 8 codewords

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Pdf417ErrorCorrectionLevel.Level3
member.summary: Error Correction Level 3 has 16 codewords

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Pdf417ErrorCorrectionLevel.Level4
member.summary: Error Correction Level 4 has 32 codewords

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Pdf417ErrorCorrectionLevel.Level5
member.summary: Error Correction Level 5 has 64 codewords

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Pdf417ErrorCorrectionLevel.Level6
member.summary: Error Correction Level 6 has 128 codewords

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Pdf417ErrorCorrectionLevel.Level7
member.summary: Error Correction Level 7 has 256 codewords

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Pdf417ErrorCorrectionLevel.Level8
member.summary: Error Correction Level 8 has 512 codewords

member.name: T:Infragistics.XF.CompactionMode
member.summary: Specify the compaction algorithm in PDF417 which is used to map 8-bit data bytes efficiently to PDF417 codewords.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.CompactionMode.Unspecified
member.summary: Choose internaly which of the three data compaction algorithm in PDF417 is the best compaction mode for the Data value and if necessary combines them.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.CompactionMode.Byte
member.summary: Byte compaction algorithm permits all 256 possible 8-bit byte values to be encoded. This includes all ASCII characters value 0 to 127 inclusive and provides for international character set support. It has compaction ratio of six bytes to five codewords and used as default graphical and control character interpretation.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.CompactionMode.Text
member.summary: Text Compaction mode encodes all ASCII chars (32-126) and HT(tab: 9), LF (line feed: 10) and CR (carriage return: 13) symbols. It compacts up to 2 chars per codeword.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.CompactionMode.Numeric
member.summary: Numeric Compaction mode permits efficient encoding of numeric data strings. It should be used to encode long strings of consecutive numeric digits. It encodes up to 2,93 numeric digits per codeword.

member.name: T:Infragistics.XF.TextSubmode
member.summary: Text Compaction sub-modes: each contains 30 characters including the latch and shift characters.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.TextSubmode.Alpha
member.summary: The default compaction mode - include uppercase alphabetic characters

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.TextSubmode.Lower
member.summary: Lower submode - include lowercase alphabetic characters

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.TextSubmode.Mixed
member.summary: Mixed - include numeric and some punctuations characters

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.TextSubmode.Punctuation
member.summary: Punctuation - include punctuation characters

member.name: T:Infragistics.XF.SizeVersion
member.summary: Size of the symblol represented in terms of its position in the sequence of permissible sizes from 21x21 modules (Version 1) to 177x177 modules (Version 40) for the QR Code symbols.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.SizeVersion.Undefined
member.summary: If set, the QR code barcode sets internally the smallest version that will accommodate the data.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.SizeVersion.Version1

member.name: T:Infragistics.XF.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel
member.summary: QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel defines the four level of Reed-Solomon error correction for the QR Code symbol.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.Low
member.summary: Low error correction level allows recovery of 7% of the symbol codewords.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.Medium
member.summary: Medium error correction level allows recovery of 15% of the symbol codewords.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.Quartil
member.summary: Quartil error correction level allows recovery of 25% of the symbol codewords.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.High
member.summary: High error correction level allows recovery of 30% of the symbol codewords.

member.name: T:Infragistics.XF.EncodingMode
member.summary: Specifies the encoding mode for compacting the data for the QR Code symbol. The modes are based on the character values and assignments associated with the default ECI (ECI 000003 representing the ISO/IEC 8859-1 character set).

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.EncodingMode.Undefined
member.summary: When Undefined encoding mode is set, the QR code barcode internally switches between modes as necessary in order to achieve the most efficient conversion of data into a binary string.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.EncodingMode.Numeric
member.summary: Numeric mode encodes data from decimal digit set (0-9). Normally 3 data characters are represented by 10 bits.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.EncodingMode.Alphanumeric
member.summary: Alphanumerc mode encodes data from a set of 45 characters (digits 0-9, upper case letters A-Z, nine other characters: space, $ % * + _ . / : ). Normally two input characters are represented by 11 bits.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.EncodingMode.Byte
member.summary: In Byte mode the data is encoded at 8 bits per character. The character set of the Byte encoding mode is byte data (by default it is ISO/IEC 8859-1 character set).

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.EncodingMode.Kanji
member.summary: The Kanji mode efficiently encodes Kanji characters in accordance with the Shift JIS system based on JIS X 0208. Each two-byte character value is compactedd to a 13-bit binary codeword.

member.name: T:Infragistics.XF.Fnc1Mode
member.summary: Fnc1Mode indicator is used for messages containing specific data formats. Fnc1Mode applies to the entire symbol and is not affected by subsequent mode indicators.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Fnc1Mode.None
member.summary: Do not use any Fnc1 symbols, i.e. the data is not identified according to specific predefined industry or application specifications.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Fnc1Mode.Gs1
member.summary: Uses Fnc1 symbol in the first position of the character in Code 128 symbols and designates data formatted in accordance with the GS1 General Specification.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Fnc1Mode.Industry
member.summary: Uses Fnc1 symbol in the second position of the character in Code 128 symbols and designates data formatted in accordance with a specific indystry application previously agreed with AIM Inc.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value which specifies how the grid fills within the barcode control dimensions.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Controls.GridBarcode.WidthToHeightRatioProperty
member.summary: Gets or sets the width (XDimension) to height (YDimension) ratio. It accepts only positive values. This property does not apply for the QR barcode.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Controls.GridBarcode.XDimensionProperty
member.summary: Gets or sets the X-dimension (narrow element width) for a symbol in mm. It accepts values from 0.01 to 100.

member.name: P:Infragistics.XF.Controls.GridBarcode.BarsFillMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which specifies how the grid fills within the barcode control dimensions.

member.name: P:Infragistics.XF.Controls.GridBarcode.WidthToHeightRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the width (XDimension) to height (YDimension) ratio. It accepts only positive values. This property does not apply for the QR barcode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.XF.Controls.GridBarcode.XDimension
member.summary: Gets or sets the X-dimension (narrow element width) for a symbol in mm. It accepts values from 0.01 to 100.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Controls.XFBarcode128.ShowTextProperty
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the barcode should have human readable text.
member.value: True if text is visible, otherwise false.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Controls.XFBarcode128.CodeTypeProperty
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the code.

member.name: P:Infragistics.XF.Controls.XFBarcode128.ShowText
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the barcode should have human readable text.
member.value: True if text is visible, otherwise false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the code.

member.name: T:Infragistics.XF.Controls.QRCodeBarcode
member.summary: Represents Infragistics Barcode control with QRCode visuals

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Controls.QRCodeBarcode.ErrorCorrectionLevelProperty
member.summary: Gets or sets the error correction level of the QR Code symbol.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Controls.QRCodeBarcode.SizeVersionProperty
member.summary: Gets or sets the size version of the QR Code symbol.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Controls.QRCodeBarcode.EncodingModeProperty
member.summary: Gets or sets the encoding mode for compaction of the QR Code symbol data. The default value is undefined if the Shift_JIS encoding is loaded. Otherwise the default value is byte.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Controls.QRCodeBarcode.EciNumberProperty
member.summary: Each Extended Channel Interpretation (ECI) is designated by a six-digit assignment number: 000000 - 999999. The default is ECI 000003, representing the ISO/IEC 8859-1 character set.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Controls.QRCodeBarcode.EciHeaderDisplayModeProperty
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the ECI header.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Controls.QRCodeBarcode.Fnc1ModeProperty
member.summary: Gets or sets the FNC1 mode indicator which identifies symbols encoding messages formatted according to specific predefined industry or application specificatoins.

member.name: F:Infragistics.XF.Controls.QRCodeBarcode.ApplicationIndicatorProperty
member.summary: Gets or sets the Application Indicator assigned to identify the specification concerned by AIM International. The value is respected only when the Fnc1Mode is set to Industry. Its value may take the form of any single Latin alphabetic character from the set {a - z, A - Z} or a two-digit number.

member.name: P:Infragistics.XF.Controls.QRCodeBarcode.ErrorCorrectionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the error correction level of the QR Code symbol.

member.name: P:Infragistics.XF.Controls.QRCodeBarcode.SizeVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the size version of the QR Code symbol.

member.name: P:Infragistics.XF.Controls.QRCodeBarcode.EncodingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the encoding mode for compaction of the QR Code symbol data. The default value is undefined if the Shift_JIS encoding is loaded. Otherwise the default value is byte.

member.name: P:Infragistics.XF.Controls.QRCodeBarcode.EciNumber
member.summary: Each Extended Channel Interpretation (ECI) is designated by a six-digit assignment number: 000000 - 999999. The default is ECI 000003, representing the ISO/IEC 8859-1 character set.

member.name: P:Infragistics.XF.Controls.QRCodeBarcode.EciHeaderDisplayMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the ECI header.

member.name: P:Infragistics.XF.Controls.QRCodeBarcode.Fnc1Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets the FNC1 mode indicator which identifies symbols encoding messages formatted according to specific predefined industry or application specificatoins.

member.name: P:Infragistics.XF.Controls.QRCodeBarcode.ApplicationIndicator
member.summary: Gets or sets the Application Indicator assigned to identify the specification concerned by AIM International. The value is respected only when the Fnc1Mode is set to Industry. Its value may take the form of any single Latin alphabetic character from the set {a - z, A - Z} or a two-digit number.
